result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Kuruc was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 310 days, if revoked.
Report to Drug Court every Wednesday @ 3:30pm
Drug court scheduled for 3/2/16 @ 3:30pm

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  $500 on deposit in 15CF112 to be applied to costs & restitution.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $7052.00 plus surcharges.
*   Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
May not have contact with victims, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Report to Drug Court every Wedesday at 3:30pm.

supervisions.notes:

records.addlTxt:
Def. should be given 348 days credit on 15CF112 and 349 days credit on 15CF356.  JOC to be amended to reflect the correction.
(No document available at time of scanning.5/11/18 bl)

Filed by ADA Tracey Braun:  the State objects to the amount of credit the def. suggests is appropriate.  But they do agree with DOC that on 15CF112 the def. would be entitled to 348 days credit, instead of 310 days, and on 15CF356, the def. would be entitled to 349 days, instead of 311.  The extra time requested as credit by the def. was applied to Dane Co case 16CF1640 and the def. would not be eligible to receive that time as credit as the sentences were to run consecutively.

Drug Court Program Participation Agreement

Defendant Thomas J. Kuruc appeared with Attorney William Michel.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the Prosecution.  Agent Jacqueline Gatlin in court.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Cts 1 & 7-Fel Misappropriate ID Info-Obtain Money-PTAC; found guilty by the court.  Cts 2-6 & 8-18 were all dismissed and read-in.  PSI report waived.
Cts 1 & 7:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 48 months w/conditions; as a condition of probation, the defendant to serve 1 day in the KCJ, forthwith.  310 days sentence credit given if revoked.  Court costs ordered.  Restitution ordered and to be paid while on probation.  $500 on deposit to be applied to costs & rest.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.  Defendant accepted into the Drug Court Program.  Drug court scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Drug Court

Per ADA Tracey Braun, def. has been accepted into the Drug Court program.  Status conf. in Br. 8 on 2/10/16 at 9:30 is removed from the calendar.  Plea and sentencing in Br. 4 scheduled for 2/10/16 at 3:15.  Parties notified by email.
Amended

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty William Michel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Amended Information filed (Counts 13 - 18 have been added charging crimes committed in Racine Co.).  Plea of not guilty entered to Amended Information.  Def. has an assessment today to see if he qualifies for participation in the Drug Court.  Status conf. 2/10/16 at 9:30.  Bond continued.
At the request of ADA Emily Trigg and Atty William Michel, FPT set for today is adj. to 1/21/16 at 10:30.

Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Atty Michel states a new offer has been received and requests an adjournment to discuss offer further.  Atty Michel states DE is also looking to get into a 6 month treatment at Wheaton.  Arguments heard on DE's bond motion and upon hearing arguments motion to modify bond is denied by the court.  FPT on 8/6/15 at 10:00 AM.
